page.title: 17Public Houses, Horsmonden
page.content: The Gun & Spitroast Inn is an old Coaching inn, built in 1480. It has a garden where customers play a game called Boule which is a bit like Bowls. The owner, Patrick Harrison, has been there for three years. They cook beef & pork on a spit over an apple-wood fire. A meal costs about 950p & they serve some 20 meals on an average evening. The King's Arms was burnt down by the King's men in 1800. The next King, George IV, had it rebuilt on the same spot & it reopened in 1832. They have an Off-licence at one side of the building & a garden by the road. They sell hot & cold food from noon to 3pm. The Town House, which is beside the King's Arms, was built in 1856. It is popular with the younger adults in the village.
